info.title: VMware vSphere Replication Management Server Configuration REST API
info.description:
Configuration REST API provides API access to DR appliance configuration functionality

Getting started with REST API

### Step 1 - Authenticate to the API Endpoint Create a session ID using the following API:

POST Login You have been authenticated and have retrieved your API session ID. ### Step 2 - Use the session ID in subsequent calls On subsequent API calls, include the session ID returned in step 1 using an HTTP header, as follows: ```http x-dr-session: MDYzYmJlZTEtMDhhMC00M2Q3LWE0YWUtNjI2Y2I3ZThjZjVi ``` ### Step 3 - Get Appliance Info Get information about the virtual appliance by using this API:

GET Get Appliance Info

get.summary: Get the installed certificate authorities (CA) certificates used to validate other server's certificates.
get.description: Get the installed certificate authorities (CA) certificates used to validate other server's certificates.

parameters.name: filter_property
parameters.description: The name of the field by which to filter the result data. Must be used in combination with filter parameter. Supports for nested fields. Example: https://dr-server/api/vms?filter_property=name&filter=vm-1

parameters.name: filter
parameters.description: The filter value by which to filter the result data. Must be used in combination with filter_prop parameter. Supports for nested fields. Example: https://dr-server/api/vms?filter_property=name&filter=vm-1&filter=vm-2

parameters.name: sort_by
parameters.description: Define desired sort by field of the result data. If order_by is not specified, ascending is used as default.

parameters.name: order_by
parameters.description: Define desired sort order by field of the result data. Must be used in combination with sort_by. Supported values: asc, ascending, desc, descending.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Specify the limit size of the result data. In combination with offset parameter provides paging functionality. If none - configuration property 'defaultResponsePageSize' in REST API configuration file is taken into account. If configuration property is not defined - default value of 100 is taken into account.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: The amount of elements to skip in the response. In combination with limit parameter provides paging functionality. Must be used in combination with limit parameter. If none - default value of 0 is taken into account. Example: https://dr-server/api/vms?limit=10&offset=10

parameters.name: filter_property
parameters.description: The name of the field by which to filter the result data. Must be used in combination with filter parameter. Supports for nested fields. Example: https://dr-server/api/vms?filter_property=name&filter=vm-1

parameters.name: filter
parameters.description: The filter value by which to filter the result data. Must be used in combination with filter_prop parameter. Supports for nested fields. Example: https://dr-server/api/vms?filter_property=name&filter=vm-1&filter=vm-2

parameters.name: sort_by
parameters.description: Define desired sort by field of the result data. If order_by is not specified, ascending is used as default.

parameters.name: order_by
parameters.description: Define desired sort order by field of the result data. Must be used in combination with sort_by. Supported values: asc, ascending, desc, descending.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Specify the limit size of the result data. In combination with offset parameter provides paging functionality. If none - configuration property 'defaultResponsePageSize' in REST API configuration file is taken into account. If configuration property is not defined - default value of 100 is taken into account.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: The amount of elements to skip in the response. In combination with limit parameter provides paging functionality. Must be used in combination with limit parameter. If none - default value of 0 is taken into account. Example: https://dr-server/api/vms?limit=10&offset=10

requestBody.description: Check whether the extension key is already registered in SSO, lookup service, and as VC extension.

401.description: Unauthorized - the client must authenticate itself to get the requested response

403.description: Forbidden - not sufficient access rights to fulfill the request

404.description: Not Found - server cannot find the requested in URL resource

500.description: Internal server error - unexpected condition prevents fulfilling the request

get.summary: Returns information about the current session, if any.
get.description: Returns information about the current session, if any.

200.description: Returns information about the currently authenticated session.

400.description: Bad request - the server cannot understand the request due to invalid syntax or invalid request body content

500.description: Internal server error - unexpected condition prevents fulfilling the request

post.summary: Logs in and returns the session ID. Include 'x-dr-session' header with the value of the returned session ID in subsequent requests.
post.description: Logs in and returns the session ID. Include 'x-dr-session' header with the value of the returned session ID in subsequent requests.

200.description: Successfully authenticated. The session ID is returned in the response body. Include 'x-dr-session' header with value of the returned session ID in subsequent requests.

400.description: Bad request - the server cannot understand the request due to invalid syntax or invalid request body content

500.description: Internal server error - unexpected condition prevents fulfilling the request

delete.summary: Logs out if the session is authenticated.
delete.description: Logs out if the session is authenticated.

204.description: Successfully logged out. The session is no longer authenticated.

get.summary: Get all support bundles available on the server.
get.description:
Get all support bundles available on the server.

Retrieves the log bundles list.

The list will have the key identifiers of the log bundles created in the current config session and still available on the appliance.

parameters.name: filter_property
parameters.description: The name of the field by which to filter the result data. Must be used in combination with filter parameter. Supports for nested fields. Example: https://dr-server/api/vms?filter_property=name&filter=vm-1

parameters.name: filter
parameters.description: The filter value by which to filter the result data. Must be used in combination with filter_prop parameter. Supports for nested fields. Example: https://dr-server/api/vms?filter_property=name&filter=vm-1&filter=vm-2

parameters.name: sort_by
parameters.description: Define desired sort by field of the result data. If order_by is not specified, ascending is used as default.

parameters.name: order_by
parameters.description: Define desired sort order by field of the result data. Must be used in combination with sort_by. Supported values: asc, ascending, desc, descending.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Specify the limit size of the result data. In combination with offset parameter provides paging functionality. If none - configuration property 'defaultResponsePageSize' in REST API configuration file is taken into account. If configuration property is not defined - default value of 100 is taken into account.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: The amount of elements to skip in the response. In combination with limit parameter provides paging functionality. Must be used in combination with limit parameter. If none - default value of 0 is taken into account. Example: https://dr-server/api/vms?limit=10&offset=10

200.description: List of support bundles available on the server.

400.description: Bad request - the server cannot understand the request due to invalid syntax or invalid request body content

401.description: Unauthorized - the client must authenticate itself to get the requested response

403.description: Forbidden - not sufficient access rights to fulfill the request

500.description: Internal server error - unexpected condition prevents fulfilling the request

post.description:
Generate support bundle.

Instructs the server to generate a system log bundle.

A log bundle includes log files and other configuration information that can be used to investigate failures.

202.description: Task is created. The generated log bundle id will be populated in the result section of the task once it's completed.

401.description: Unauthorized - the client must authenticate itself to get the requested response

403.description: Forbidden - not sufficient access rights to fulfill the request

500.description: Internal server error - unexpected condition prevents fulfilling the request

delete.summary: Delete the existing support bundle on the server.
delete.description:
Delete the existing support bundle on the server.

Instructs the server that this log bundle is no longer needed by the client that generated it.

The server can then safely delete the file.

parameters.description: The key identifier of a support bundle.

partition_name.description: Partition name of the appliance disk.

total_space.description: Total space on the appliance disk.

used_space.description: Used space on the appliance disk.

used_space_percent.description: Percent for ratio used size per total size.

ApplianceDisk.description: Detailed information about an appliance disk.

ApplianceDiskDrResponseEntity.description: Detailed information about an appliance disk.

ApplianceDiskDrResponseList.description: List of entities about: Detailed information about an appliance disk.

product_build_number.description: The product build number of the appliance.

product_name.description: The product name of the appliance.

appliance_build_number.description: The build number of the appliance.

serial_number.description: The serial number of the certificate, represented as string. The serial number is a number assigned by the certification authority to each certificate. It must be unique for each certificate issued by a given CA (i.e., the issuer name and serial number identify a unique certificate).

not_after.description: End date, represented as number of milliseconds, from the validity period of the certificate.

not_before.description: Start date, represented as number of milliseconds, from the validity period of the certificate.

signature.description: Signature value as Base64 encoded string (with ISO-8859-1 charset) from the certificate.

issuer_dn.description: Issuer distinguished name of the certificate.
issuer_dn.example: C=US, OU=DR Division, O="VMware, Inc.", CN="VMware, Inc."

subject_dn.description: Subject distinguished name of the certificate.
subject_dn.example: C=US, OU=DR Division, O="VMware, Inc.", CN="VMware, Inc."

sig_alg_name.description: Gets the signature algorithm name for the certificate signature algorithm.

sig_alg_oid.description:
Signature algorithm OID string from the certificate.
An OID is represented by a set of nonnegative whole numbers separated by periods.

public_key_format.description: Public key format of the certificate.

public_key_algorithm.description: Public key algorithm of the certificate.

key_usage.description:
Boolean array representing bits of the KeyUsage extension, (OID = 2.5.29.15). The key usage extension defines the purpose (e.g., encipherment, signature, certificate signing) of the key contained in the certificate. The ASN.1 definition for this is: 
KeyUsage ::= BIT STRING {
     digitalSignature        (0),
     nonRepudiation          (1),
     keyEncipherment         (2),
     dataEncipherment        (3),
     keyAgreement            (4),
     keyCertSign             (5),
     cRLSign                 (6),
     encipherOnly            (7),
     decipherOnly            (8) }

items.description:
Boolean array representing bits of the KeyUsage extension, (OID = 2.5.29.15). The key usage extension defines the purpose (e.g., encipherment, signature, certificate signing) of the key contained in the certificate. The ASN.1 definition for this is: 
KeyUsage ::= BIT STRING {
     digitalSignature        (0),
     nonRepudiation          (1),
     keyEncipherment         (2),
     dataEncipherment        (3),
     keyAgreement            (4),
     keyCertSign             (5),
     cRLSign                 (6),
     encipherOnly            (7),
     decipherOnly            (8) }

extended_key_usage.description: Indicates one or more purposes for which the certified public key may be used, in addition to or in place of the basic purposes indicated in the key usage extension field.

items.description: Indicates one or more purposes for which the certified public key may be used, in addition to or in place of the basic purposes indicated in the key usage extension field.

value.description: CA certificate in the PEM format.

serial_number.description: The serial number of the certificate, represented as string. The serial number is a number assigned by the certification authority to each certificate. It must be unique for each certificate issued by a given CA (i.e., the issuer name and serial number identify a unique certificate).

not_after.description: End date, represented as number of milliseconds, from the validity period of the certificate.

not_before.description: Start date, represented as number of milliseconds, from the validity period of the certificate.

signature.description: Signature value as Base64 encoded string (with ISO-8859-1 charset) from the certificate.

issuer_dn.description: Issuer distinguished name of the certificate.
issuer_dn.example: C=US, OU=DR Division, O="VMware, Inc.", CN="VMware, Inc."

subject_dn.description: Subject distinguished name of the certificate.
subject_dn.example: C=US, OU=DR Division, O="VMware, Inc.", CN="VMware, Inc."

sig_alg_name.description: Gets the signature algorithm name for the certificate signature algorithm.

sig_alg_oid.description:
Signature algorithm OID string from the certificate.
An OID is represented by a set of nonnegative whole numbers separated by periods.

public_key_format.description: Public key format of the certificate.

public_key_algorithm.description: Public key algorithm of the certificate.

key_usage.description:
Boolean array representing bits of the KeyUsage extension, (OID = 2.5.29.15). The key usage extension defines the purpose (e.g., encipherment, signature, certificate signing) of the key contained in the certificate. The ASN.1 definition for this is: 
KeyUsage ::= BIT STRING {
     digitalSignature        (0),
     nonRepudiation          (1),
     keyEncipherment         (2),
     dataEncipherment        (3),
     keyAgreement            (4),
     keyCertSign             (5),
     cRLSign                 (6),
     encipherOnly            (7),
     decipherOnly            (8) }

items.description:
Boolean array representing bits of the KeyUsage extension, (OID = 2.5.29.15). The key usage extension defines the purpose (e.g., encipherment, signature, certificate signing) of the key contained in the certificate. The ASN.1 definition for this is: 
KeyUsage ::= BIT STRING {
     digitalSignature        (0),
     nonRepudiation          (1),
     keyEncipherment         (2),
     dataEncipherment        (3),
     keyAgreement            (4),
     keyCertSign             (5),
     cRLSign                 (6),
     encipherOnly            (7),
     decipherOnly            (8) }

extended_key_usage.description: Indicates one or more purposes for which the certified public key may be used, in addition to or in place of the basic purposes indicated in the key usage extension field.

items.description: Indicates one or more purposes for which the certified public key may be used, in addition to or in place of the basic purposes indicated in the key usage extension field.

trusted_issuer.example: C=US, OU=DR Division, O="VMware, Inc.", CN="VMware, Inc."

root.description: Whether this is root certificate. If false - this is intermediate certificate.

CaX509CertificateDrResponseList.description: List of entities about: CA certificate in X509 format.

value.description: Certificate signing request in PEM format.

CertificateSigningRequestData.description: Certificate signing request to be signed.

CertificateSigningRequestDataDrResponseE.description: Certificate signing request to be signed.

common_name.description: Common name to be set in CSR. Usually, it is the fully qualified domain name for the server. If not set, data provided in FQDN (OS hostname) will be used.

organization.description: The exact legal name of your organization. Do not use an abbreviation. If not set, VMware default is used.

organization_unit.description: Section of the organization. If not set, VMware default is used.

fqdn.description: A list of comma-separated FQDN strings to be used for SAN extensions. If not set, OS hostname is used.

ip.description: A list of comma-separated IP strings to be used for SAN extensions. Will be empty, if not set.

locality.description: The city where organization is legally located. If not set, VMware default will be used.

state.description: The state or province where organization is legally located. Do not use an abbreviation. If not set, VMware default is used.

country.description: The two-letter ISO abbreviation for organization country. If not set, 'US' default is used.

email.description: An email address to contact the organization. Will be empty, if not set.

CertificateSigningRequestInputData.description: Data to be used for generating the signing request.

extension_key.description: The extension key to be checked.

CheckExtensionKeyRegistrationSpec.description: Data to be used to check extension key registration.

site_name.description: The DR site name. If not set, the site name will be read from the current DR configuration if it exists.

host_name.description: The appliance FQDN. Used when registering with the infrastructure and management nodes. If not set, the DNS name will be used.

extension_key.description: The solution extension key. For vSphere Replication "com.vmware.vcHms" must be used. If not set, the default extension key value of "com.vmware.vcDr" will be used.

clock_tolerance_seconds.description: The allowed server clock tolerance in seconds. If not set, the default value of 3 seconds will be used. This parameter will be used only when validating the VC server where DR solution will be registered. Clock difference between the DR virtual appliance and vCenter Server should not exceed this value, otherwise validation (or configuration) will fail.

local_server_uuid.description: UUID of the local DR server. Filled when the server is returning this data object.

ConfigurationInfo.description: Information about the current appliance configuration.

ConfigurationInfoDrResponseEntity.description: Information about the current appliance configuration.

psc_uri.description: The PSC node URI. FQDN + optional port. If port not specified 443 will be used.

psc_thumbprint.description: Thumbprint of the PSC node's certificate. When the correct value is provided, all security checks of the certificate are off.

vc_instance_id.description: Identifier of the MGMT node to register with.

vc_thumbprint.description: Thumbprint of the MGMT node's certificate.

ConnectionSpecData.description: Contains connection information for a service. If not set the connection parameters will be read from the current DR solution configuration if it exists.

admin_user.description: The name of a user with sufficient privileges to perform configuration tasks on the infrastructure, management nodes, and the infrastructure node.

certificate.description: New server certificate to be used in PEM format.

ca_chain.description: A list of intermediate CA certificates used to sign server certificate in PEM format.

items.description: A list of intermediate CA certificates used to sign server certificate in PEM format.

CsrCertificateData.description: Signed certificate data based on a generated CSR.

mode.description: Mode of the domain name system.

hostname.description: Host name of the domain name system.

servers.description: Servers to be used for STATIC mode. Value ignored when DHCP mode.

items.description: Servers to be used for STATIC mode. Value ignored when DHCP mode.

InstallCertificateSpec.description:
Specification to install new certificate:
  • selfsignedFormat - Generate and install new self-signed certificate.
  • csrFormat - Install signed certificate based on a generated CSR.
  • pkcs12Format - Install PKCS#12 certificate.

Initialize ONLY the property corresponding to the desired certificate installation format. Leave rest of the fields null or unset.

address.description: IPv4 address, for example, "10.20.80.191". Value not needed when DHCP mode.

default_gateway.description: IPv4 address of the default gateway. Value not needed when DHCP mode.

assignment_mode.description:
Address assignment mode:
  • DCHP - IPv4 address is automatically assigned by a DHCP server.
  • STATIC - IPv4 address is static.
  • UNCONFIGURED - The IPv4 protocol is not configured.

prefix.description: IPv4 CIDR prefix, for example , 24.> See http://www.oav.net/mirrors/cidr.html for netmask-to-prefix conversion. Value not needed when DHCP mode.

autoconfigure.description: Address is assigned by Stateless Address Autoconfiguration (SLAAC). This option can be set to true in parallel with dhcp and static IPv6 addresses.

dhcp.description: Address assigned by a DHCP server. This option can be set to true in parallel with autoconf and static IPv6 addresses.

default_gateway.description: Default gateway for static IP address assignment. This configures the global IPv6 default gateway on the appliance with the specified gateway address and interface. This gateway replaces the existing default gateway configured on the appliance. However, if the gateway address is link-local, then it is added for that interface. This does not support configuration of multiple global default gateways through different interfaces.

addresses.description: A list of addresses to be statically assigned. Values can be available in parallel with set dhcp and autoconf.

psc_thumbprint.description: Thumbprint of the PSC node's certificate. When the correct value is provided all security checks of the certificate are off.

service_id.description: Optionally narrow VC search to a specific service ID.

field.description: JSONPath of the entity field that causes this error.

Metadata.description: Response meta data. Contains data about the response payload data.

source.description: Source path of the mount point. This is a path outside the container.

destination.description: Destination path where the {@link #source} is mounted at. This is a path inside the container.

MountPoint.description: Information about the bind mount of a container of a storage replication adapter. For more information see https://docs.docker.com/storage/bind-mounts.

NetworkInterfaceInfoDrResponseList.description: List of entities about: Information about network interface.

certificate.description: The certificate as string. Base64 encoded.

Pkcs12CertificateData.description: Data to be used to install PKCS12 certificate.

ProbeSslSpec.description: URI of the endpoint to probe.

ReconfigureRequired.description: Details whether reconfigure operation is required after upgrade.

ReconfigureRequiredDrResponseEntity.description: Details whether reconfigure operation is required after upgrade.

filter_ip.description: IP to be used for vSphere Replication Server replication traffic. Can be empty.

management_ip.description: IP to be used for vSphere Replication Server management traffic. Can be empty.

ReplicationServerSettings.description: This data object type describes the vSphere Replication Server filter and management traffic.

ReplicationServerSettingsDrResponseEntit.description: This data object type describes the vSphere Replication Server filter and management traffic.

id.description: Id of the service. Sometimes might be the same as its name.

name.description: Name of the service. Sometimes might be the same as its id.

startup_type.description: Startup type. Value must be one of the StartupTypeEnum. Example: "Automatic".

is_running.description: Boolean value indicating if the service is running.

ServiceInfoDrResponseList.description: List of entities about: Detailed information about a service.

SessionIdData.description: Data including the new session id.

username.description: User name for the current session.

image_id.description: SHA256 ID of the image from which the container was instantiated.

mount_points.description: Mount points the container has, if any.

SraContainer.description: Information about the container of a storage replication adapter.

value.description: The string representation of a data.

StringDrData.description: Contains string representation of a data.

key.description: The unique key identifier of this bundle.

time_created.description: The time when the bundle was generated, in milliseconds. This is the local server time in UTC.

size.description: The size in bytes of the diagnostic bundle file.

md5.description: The MD5 checksum for the bundle file.

SupportBundleInfo.description: Support bundle, containing logs, dumps and configuration files.

SupportBundleInfoDrResponseEntity.description: Support bundle, containing logs, dumps and configuration files.

SupportBundleInfoDrResponseList.description: List of entities about: Support bundle, containing logs, dumps and configuration files.

SyslogServerInfoDrResponseList.description: List of entities about: Information about syslog server.

result.description: Information about the task result if the task status is SUCCESS.

progress.description: The current progress of the task, in percentage number.

start_time.description: The start time of the task, in milliseconds.

complete_time.description: The complete time of the task, in milliseconds.

TaskDrResponseList.description: List of entities about: Info about a task.

TaskError.description: Detailed information about the error if the task status is ERROR.

message.description: The message which will be sent to all syslog servers.

TestMessage.description: Test message to be sent to all syslog servers.

mode.description:
Time synchronization settings:
  • DISABLED - Time synchronization is deactivated.
  • NTP - NTP-based time synchronization.
  • HOST - VMware Tool-based time synchronization.

TimeZoneDrResponseList.description: List of entities about: Information about a time zone.

release_date.description: Release date of the update, in milliseconds.

reboot_required.description: Boolean to indicate whether a reboot is required.

UpdateNetworkInterfaceInfoSpec.description: Spec to update network interface configuration.

username.description:
Appliance username.
The user for which the password will be changed.
For now this parameter is not taken into account.

new_password.description:
New password for the appliance user.
    Requirements:
  • at least 8 characters long
  • with minimum one small letter
  • with minimum one capital letter
  • with minimum one number
  • with minimum one special character
  • differs from the last five passwords

mounted_iso.description: True if the appliance has a mounted ISO for updates. In this case - url, user name and password fields must be null.

username.description: User name for the update repository. If a user name is specified, a password is required as well.

password.description: Password for the update repository. If a user name is specified, a password is required as well.

VcConnectionSpec.description: Data to be used to connect to vSphere infrastructure.

VcInfoDrResponseList.description: List of entities about: Structure containing VC information.
